intro: Hoorebekia hirta, commonly known as the hairy helenium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and it blooms from late summer into early autumn. Hoorebekia hirta is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
